p: In Fig. 1, we show a comparison of the interlayer spacing between the bulk-truncated Cu(410) (cf., Fig. 1(a) (lower panel)) and the QLEED-determined relaxed Cu(410) (Fig. 1(b) (lower panel). The theoretical I( E) curves, determined using 16 optimized relaxed layers, and the experimental I( E) curves, show good agreement, with R P = 0.08 (Fig. 2). We found that Cu(410) exhibits an alternating sequence of expansion (+) and contraction (−), viz., (+; −; +; −; +; −; −), as compared to the bulk-truncated interlayer spacing (ca. 0.437 Å). In Table 1, we show the resulting interlayer relaxation and positions of the top 16 relaxed atoms relative to the bulk crystal.
